Class TranscriptionEndpoint

Transcribe audio into text, with optional translation into English.

public class TranscriptionEndpoint : EndpointBase, ITranscriptionEndpoint

Properties

| Improve this Doc View Source

DefaultRequestArgs

This allows you to set default parameters for every request, for example to set a default language. For every request, if you do not have a parameter set on the request but do have it set here as a default, the request will automatically pick up the default value.

Declaration
public AudioRequest DefaultRequestArgs { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
AudioRequest
| Improve this Doc View Source

Endpoint

The name of the endpoint, which is the final path segment in the API URL. Must be overriden in a derived class.

Declaration
protected override string Endpoint { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.String
Overrides
EndpointBase.Endpoint

Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

GetAsFormatAsync(Stream, String, String, String, String, Nullable<Double>)

Gets the transcription of the audio stream, in the specified format

Declaration
public async Task<string> GetAsFormatAsync(Stream audioStream, string filename, string responseFormat, string language = null, string prompt = null, double? temperature = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.IO.Stream audioStream

The stream containing audio data, in one of these formats: flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, or webm.
System.String filename

The name of the audio file in the stream. This does not have to be real, but it must contain the correct file extension. For example, "file.mp3" if you are supplying an mp3 audio stream.
System.String responseFormat

The format of the response. Suggested value are SRT or VTT. For text and Json formats, try GetTextAsync(Stream, String, String, String, Nullable<Double>) or GetWithDetailsAsync(Stream, String, String, String, Nullable<Double>) instead.
System.String language

The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in ISO-639-1 format will improve accuracy and latency.
System.String prompt

An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language.
System.Nullable<System.Double> temperature

The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.
Returns
Type Description
System.Threading.Tasks.Task<System.String>

A string of the transcribed text
| Improve this Doc View Source

GetAsFormatAsync(String, String, String, String, Nullable<Double>)

Gets the transcription of the audio file, in the specified format

Declaration
public async Task<string> GetAsFormatAsync(string audioFilePath, string responseFormat, string language = null, string prompt = null, double? temperature = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String audioFilePath

The local path to the audio file, in one of these formats: flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, or webm.
System.String responseFormat

The format of the response. Suggested value are SRT or VTT. For text and Json formats, try GetTextAsync(String, String, String, Nullable<Double>) or GetWithDetailsAsync(String, String, String, Nullable<Double>) instead.
System.String language

The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in ISO-639-1 format will improve accuracy and latency.
System.String prompt

An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language.
System.Nullable<System.Double> temperature

The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.
Returns
Type Description

GetTextAsync(Stream, String, String, String, Nullable<Double>)

Gets the transcription of the audio stream as a text string

Declaration
public async Task<string> GetTextAsync(Stream audioStream, string filename, string language = null, string prompt = null, double? temperature = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.IO.Stream audioStream

The stream containing audio data, in one of these formats: flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, or webm.
System.String filename

The name of the audio file in the stream. This does not have to be real, but it must contain the correct file extension. For example, "file.mp3" if you are supplying an mp3 audio stream.
System.String language

The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in ISO-639-1 format will improve accuracy and latency.
System.String prompt

An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language.
System.Nullable<System.Double> temperature

The sampling temperature, between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0, the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit.
Returns
